fuel.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a substance such as coal, gas, or oil that can be burned to produce heat or energy
fuel.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Coal is one of the cheapest fuels.
fuel.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: Global warming may be caused by burning fossil fuels.

The number of homes using solid fuel for heating has decreased.
There has been a sharp rise in domestic fuel costs.
The government is trying to encourage the use of environmentally-friendly smokeless fuels.
Modern cars run on unleaded fuel.
Are green fuels, like Biodiesel, really the solution to our fuel crisis?

People need to learn how to use fuel more efficiently.

The ship ran out of fuel and drifted helplessly.

The fuel tank holds 14 gallons of petrol.
I noticed the fuel gauge was on empty so I pulled into the nearest gas station.
The car's fuel pump was leaking.
Fuel consumption averages 54 miles per gallon.
Greater engine efficiency has led to improved fuel economy.
something is running low on fuel
The plane was running low on fuel.
fuel.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to make something, especially something bad, increase or become stronger
fuel.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: His words fuelled her anger still more.
Progress was slow, fueling concerns that the stadium would not be finished on time.
fuel.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: if you fuel a vehicle, or if it fuels up, fuel is put into it

fuel.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: a substance such as coal, gas, or oil that can be burned to produce heat or energy
fuel.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The Postal Service lost $450 million last year, primarily because of higher labor and fuel costs.
fuel.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to cause a situation to change quickly
fuel.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: Consumers will continue to fuel economic growth.
